intro: Anastraphia montana, commonly known as the mountain anastraphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
